column4: Stupid Question : Can't i cd a folder whose name has space in it ? e.g "NTFS Packages"???
don't just download random files - use the package manager
there is a .deb for nedit - you might be able to install that if the dependencies are OK
to see dependencies, run  apt-cache depends nedit
it's dangerous running as root, as you probably know
NO - I told you where to look
don't use the tar.bz2 or whatever
if there's an installed deb it will show
have you enabled dma on your drives?
